result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C Morrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Daryl W Laatsch.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Case recalled following motion hearing and a recess. Agreement reached. Def pleads guilty; is convicted and sentenced.

Def in person & by Atty Daryl W Laatsch.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Witness: Sgt. Amy Vaughn (WCSO). Court takes judicial notice of case 14cm1104. Argument by counsel. Court finds that Miranda does not apply and defendant's statements were voluntary. Therefore, defendant's motion to suppress statements is denied and statements can be used at trial.
15R 017888  Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office
Motion hearing at 09-17-2015 02:30 pm

Def in person & by Atty Daryl W Laatsch.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Witness: Officer Alan Patrick Skellett (WCSD). Court takes judicial notice of 14cm1104. Argument by counsel. Court finds that def was not taken into custody, was not interrogated and defendant's statements were voluntary and are admissible. Court finds def was not advised of Miranda rights, but Miranda does not apply. Therefore, defendant's motion is denied. Atty Giernoth requests hearing be set on introduction of additional statements through a different officer.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Letter received from LM

Motion hearing at 08-25-2015 09:30 am.
Jury trial at 09-24-2015 08:30 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Daryl W Laatsch.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State. Atty Laatsch states case not resolved. No PT motions have been filed. State has adj request on file, which was not timely filed. Defense not opposed to adj request. Atty Sandra Giernoth now also appears for State. Miranda/Goodchild motion hearing willl likely be needed. Court grants adj request.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State. Information filed and served on defendant. Court enters NG plea on defendant's behalf. Def referred back to SPD.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State. Def has not pursued counsel; requests to proceed without counsel. Witness: Officer Michael Huber (WCSD). State rests. Defendant requests case be dismissed. State moves for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 06-17-2015 09:30 am

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Def waives counsel to PT with DA. Def requests timely preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
